1402.text: [[Kingdom of Castile]] begins with the invasion of the [[Canary Islands]]

1415.text: The [[Portuguese Empire|Portuguese empire]] begins with the capture of [[Ceuta]] ([[Morocco]])

1441.text: The first consignment of [[History of slavery|slaves]] is brought to [[Lisbon]] (Portugal)

1452.text: [[Papal bull|Papal Bull]] ''[[Dum Diversas|Dum diversas]]'' allows enslavement of pagans

1455.text: [[Papal bull|Papal Bull]] ''[[Romanus Pontifex]]'' grants a trade monopoly for newly discovered countries in Africa and Asia to the Portuguese.

1474.text: [[João Vaz Corte-Real]], a Portuguese navigator, claims to have discovered the ''New Land of the Codfish'', an unidentified island of which there is some speculation that it might be [[Newfoundland (island)|Newfoundland]], in present-day Canada.

1482.text: The Portuguese build the [[Elmina Castle]] as the first trading point in [[Ghana]]

1488.text: [[Bartolomeu Dias]] rounded the [[Cape of Good Hope]] for the [[kingdom of Portugal|Portuguese king]].

1492.text: Discovery of the [[New World]] and symbolic date of the [[Age of Discovery|European Age of Exploration]]; beginning of the [[European colonization of the Americas|colonization of the Americas]] and of the [[Columbian Exchange]]

1494.text: [[Treaty of Tordesillas]] dividing the world outside of Europe in an exclusive duopoly between the [[Spanish Empire|Spanish]] and the [[Portuguese Empire|Portuguese empire]]s along a north–south meridian 370 leagues west of the [[Cape Verde]] islands (off the west coast of Africa), roughly 46° 36' W. (This boundary was known as the ''Line of Demarcation''.)  The lands to the east would belong to Portugal and the lands to the west to Spain.

1498.text: [[Vasco da Gama]] sets foot on [[Kozhikode]], starting the Portuguese presence in [[India]]

1500.text: [[Pedro Álvares Cabral]] sails to [[Brazil]] for the Portuguese king

1515.text: Spanish ''[[Laws of Burgos|Leyes de Burgos]]'' on January 25

1519.text: The Portuguese capture [[Ormus]], in the [[Strait of Hormuz]], in the [[Persian Gulf]]

text: Spanish ''[[New Laws|Leyes Nuevas]]'' ('New Laws')
Creation of the [[Viceroyalty of Peru]]

1550–1552.text: [[Valladolid debate|Valladolid Controversy]] and publication of ''[[A Short Account of the Destruction of the Indies]]'' by Bishop of [[Chiapas]] [[Bartolomé de las Casas]]

1600.text: Queen [[Elizabeth I of England]] grants a [[Royal charter]] to the [[East India Company|English East India Company]]

1602.text: Establishment of the [[Dutch East India Company]]

1607.text: The [[English colonial empire|first permanent English settlement]] in North America at [[Jamestown, Virginia]]

1612–1615.text: The Portuguese captured [[Bandar-Abbas|Gamru Port]] and a few other places (like [[Hormuz Island]] ) in southern coast of [[Iran|Persia]].

1615–1622.text: [[Abbas I of Persia|Abbas I]], king of Persia, battled the Portuguese with the aid of the [[Royal Navy]] and the [[East India Company|English East India Company]] and recaptured those lands.

1619.text: The first [[Atlantic slave trade|African slaves]] arrive in Jamestown, Virginia

1624.text: The [[English colonial empire|English]] set foot in [[Surat]]

1625.text: [[Charles I of England]] receives [[Oldman (king)|Oldman]], king of the [[Miskito people|Miskito Nation]], who was taken to England by the [[Robert Rich, 3rd Earl of Warwick|Earl of Warwick]].

1717.text: Creation of the [[Viceroyalty of New Granada]]

text: Creation of the [[Viceroyalty of the Río de la Plata]]
The [[Thirteen colonies|thirteen original colonies]] of the [[United States]] [[United States Declaration of Independence|declare independence]] from [[Kingdom of Great Britain|Britain]]

1788.text: Britain claims and proceeds to settle the eastern half of the continent of Australia.

1791–1804.text: [[Haitian Revolution]] and [[abolitionism|abolition of slavery]] by the [[French First Republic]] (reestablished by [[Napoleon I of France|Napoleon]] in 1804)

1795.text: Britain invades the Cape region of present-day South Africa

1798.text: [[Napoleonic Campaign in Egypt|French Invasion of Egypt]]

1804–1813.text: [[First Serbian Uprising|Uprising in Serbia]] against the presence of the [[Ottoman Empire]]

1815–1817.text: [[Second Serbian Uprising|Serbian Uprising]] leading to [[Serbia]]n [[Autonomous area|autonomy]]

1820.text: The [[American Colonization Society]] (private citizens in the United States) created [[Liberia]]

1822.text: Independence of [[Empire of Brazil|Brazil]] proclaimed by [[Pedro I of Brazil|Dom Pedro I]]

1830.text: Start of the [[French Algeria|French conquest of Algeria]]

1833.text: British [[Abolitionism in the United Kingdom|abolish slavery]] in the [[British West Indies|West Indies]]; The owners are reimbursed.

1839.text: Papal Encyclical In [[In supremo apostolatus|Supremo Apostolatus]], condemning the slave trade

1846–1848.text: [[Mexican–American War]], which results in the [[Mexican Cession]]

1848.text: [[Decree|Decree-law]] [[Victor Schœlcher]] which abolish slavery (permanently) in the [[French colonial empire]]

1857.text: [[Indian Rebellion of 1857|Uprising in India against British occupation]], which leads to the creation of the [[British Raj]]

1861–1867.text: [[French intervention in Mexico]] ordered by [[Napoleon III of France|Napoleon III]]

1870–1880s.text: [[Conquest of the Desert]] in [[History of Argentina|Argentina]], led by [[Julio Argentino Roca]]

1877–1878.text: [[Russo-Turkish War (1877–1878)|War between Russia and the Ottoman Empire]] and March 3, 1878 [[Treaty of San Stefano]]

1878.text: [[Treaty of Berlin (1878)|Treaty of Berlin]] recognising the independence of [[Romania]], [[Serbia]] and [[Montenegro]] and the autonomy of [[Bulgaria]]

1883.text: Publication of ''[[The Story of an African Farm]]'' by [[Olive Schreiner]]

1884–85.text: [[Berlin Conference (1884)|Berlin Conference]] (UK, France, Germany) which sets the [[right of conquest]] for the [[scramble for Africa]]

text: Foundation of the [[Indian National Congress]]
[[Treaty of Simulambuco]] (between Portugal and the [[Ngoyo|N'Goyo Kingdom]]).

1888.text: ''[[Lei Áurea]]'' ('Golden Law') on May 13 in [[Empire of Brazil|Brazil]] which abolish slavery

text: [[República Velha|Foundation of the Republic of Brazil]]
[[British South Africa Company]] of [[Cecil Rhodes]] chartered by the British government to seek treaties and administer territory between the [[Limpopo River]] and [[African Great Lakes]].

1890.text: [[Cecil Rhodes]] sends the [[Pioneer Column]] into [[Mashonaland]], starting the process of annexing the territory which became [[Southern Rhodesia]]

1891.text: The [[Stairs Expedition to Katanga]] kills its king, [[Msiri]] and obtains treaties from his successors for the territory to become the possession of [[Leopold II of Belgium]]

text: [[Treaty of Shimonoseki]] between [[Empire of Japan|Japan]] and [[Qing Dynasty|China]] and [[Triple Intervention]]
Creation of [[French West Africa]] (AOF)

1897.text: ''[[Punitive expedition|Punitive Expedition]]'' led by British Admiral [[Harry Rawson]] against [[Benin City|Benin]], which brings to an end the highly sophisticated [[West Africa]]n [[Benin Empire|Kingdom of Benin]]

text: [[Fashoda Incident]]
[[Spanish–American War]]. United States defeated Spain and seizes Cuba, Puerto Rico, and the Philippines.

1899.text: Publication of [[Rudyard Kipling]]'s ''[[The White Man's Burden]]'', as well as [[Joseph Conrad]]'s ''[[Heart of Darkness]]''

text: [[Partition of Bengal (1905)|Partition of Bengal]]
[[First Moroccan Crisis]] after the March 31, 1905 visit of [[Wilhelm II, German Emperor|Kaiser Wilhelm]] to [[Tangier]]s

1906.text: [[Algeciras Conference]] to mediate the [[First Moroccan Crisis|Tangier Crisis]] between France and Germany

text: [[Agadir Crisis]]
[[Xinhai Revolution|Chinese Revolution]]

1912.text: France establish a full [[protectorate]] over [[History of Morocco|Morocco]]

1912–1913.text: [[Italo-Turkish War]] ([[Tripolitania]] and [[Cyrenaica]] are transferred from the Ottoman Empire to Italy)

1916–1918.text: [[Arab Revolt]] initiated by [[Hussein bin Ali, Sharif of Mecca|Hussein bin Ali]] and [[Emir]] [[Faisal I of Iraq|Faisal]]

text: [[Woodrow Wilson]]'s January 9 speech on the [[Fourteen Points]]

Foundation of the [[League of Nations]] at the [[Paris Peace Conference, 1919|Paris Peace Conference]] and creation of the [[League of Nations mandate|League of Nations Mandate]]s ([[British Mandate of Mesopotamia|Iraq]] and [[Mandatory Palestine|Palestine]] — including [[Emirate of Transjordan|Transjordan]] — are passed to Great Britain's control, [[French Mandate of Lebanon|Lebanon]] and [[French Mandate of Syria|Syria to France]]; the [[Cameroons]] and [[Togoland]] are split between the UK and France; [[Ruanda-Urundi]] goes to [[Belgium]] and [[Tanganyika]] to the UK; [[Nauru]] and [[New Guinea]] to [[Australia]]; the remainder of [[German New Guinea]] to Japan as the [[South Seas Mandate]]; [[Samoa]] to [[New Zealand]] and [[South West Africa]] to [[South Africa]])
[[Third Anglo-Afghan War]]
[[Non-cooperation movement|Non-Cooperation Movement]] led by [[Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi|Mahatma Gandhi]]
[[San Remo conference]] in April

[[Treaty of Sèvres]] on August 10 between the [[Triple Entente]] (UK, France and Russia) and the [[Ottoman Empire]]; [[Mustafa Kemal Atatürk|Mustafa Kemal]] leads the [[Turkish War of Independence]] leading to the 1923 [[Treaty of Lausanne]]

1923.text: Proclamation of the [[Turkey|Republic of Turkey]] by Mustafa Kemal on October 29

1925.text: Foundation of the Algerian [[Étoile Nord-Africaine|Star of North Africa]] by [[Messali Hadj]]

1921–1926.text: [[Rif War (1920)|Rif War]] in Morocco, led by [[Muhammad Ibn 'Abd al-Karim al-Khattabi|Abd el-Krim]]

1927.text: May 19 [[Treaty of Jeddah (1927)|Treaty of Jeddah]] accords independence to [[Saudi Arabia]] led by King [[Ibn Saud|Abdul Aziz]]

1927–1928.text: Publication of [[André Gide]]'s ''[[Voyage au Congo]]'' (''Travels in [[Republic of the Congo|the Congo]]'').

text: [[Paris Colonial Exposition]]
Dominions of Australia, Canada, New Zealand, and South Africa gain independence from Britain

1933.text: Publication of [[Gilberto Freyre]]'s ''Casa-Grande & Senzala'' ('The Great House and the Slave Quarters' - 1933)

1936.text: [[Franco-Syrian Treaty of Independence (1936)|Franco-Syrian Treaty of Independence]] (never ratified by France)

1936–1939.text: [[1936–1939 Arab revolt in Palestine|Great Arab Revolt]] in the [[Mandatory Palestine|British Mandate of Palestine]]

1941: [[Atlantic Charter|Atlantic charter]] Endorsed by all the [[Allies of World War II]]; Calls for self-determination
Foundation of the [[Viet Minh]] by [[Ho Chi Minh]]
[[Syria]] proclaims its independence from [[Vichy France]], which is recognized in 1944

1942.text: [[Quit India Movement]] called for by Gandhi on August 9

1944.text: Nelson Mandela joins the [[African National Congress]]

1945: [[Allies of World War II]] form the [[United Nations]] in San Francisco
[[Proklamasi|Proclamation of the independence of Indonesia]] by [[Sukarno]] & [[Mohammad Hatta]]
[[North Vietnam|Proclamation of the independence of Vietnam]] by Ho Chi Minh
Foundation of the [[Arab League]] on March 22 ([[Egypt]], [[Iraq]], [[Jordan]], [[Lebanon]], [[Saudi Arabia]], [[Syria]] and [[Yemen]])
Fifty states sign the [[United Nations Charter|Charter of the United Nations]] on June 26

1945–1950.text: [[Chinese Civil War]] between the nationalist [[Kuomintang]] and the [[Communist Party of China|Communist Party]] led by [[Mao Zedong]]

1947: Official start of the [[Cold War]] (see [[Cold War (1947–1953)|Cold War (1947-1953)]] and [[Cold War (1953–1962)|Cold War (1953-1962)]])
[[Partition of India|Independence of India and of Pakistan]] (Pakistan came into being on August 14, and India on August 15)
[[United Nations Partition Plan for Palestine|UN Resolution 181 on the partition of Palestine]] in favor of a [[Two-state solution]].
[[History of Madagascar|French repression of the Malagasy uprising]]. 90 to 100 000 killed.

text: [[Declaration of Independence (Israel)|Declaration of the independence of the State of Israel]] on May 14 and first [[1948 Arab–Israeli War|Arab-Israeli War]]
Colonial exhibition in Belgium

1949.text: Proclamation of the [[People's Republic of China]] by [[Mao Zedong]]

1951.text: Publication of [[Hannah Arendt]]'s ''[[The Origins of Totalitarianism]]'' (second section dedicated to imperialism)

text: [[French India|French establishments in India]] cease to exist after ''de facto'' transfer to the [[Republic of India]] (''de jure'' union accomplished in 1962)
[[Battle of Dien Bien Phu]] & [[Geneva Conference (1954)|1954 Geneva Accords]] marks the end of [[French Indochina]]
[[Suez Crisis]] between Israel, the UK and France against Egypt, after [[Gamal Abdel Nasser|Nasser]]'s [[Nationalization|nationalisation]] of the [[Suez Canal Company]]
[[Algeria]]n independence militant [[Larbi Ben M'hidi|Larbi Ben M'Hidi]] murdered in prison, early March

1957.text: First country sub-Saharan Africa (Ghana) regains independence.

1958.text: Foundation of the [[United Arab Republic]] as a first step toward a [[Pan-Arabism|Pan-Arab]] nation; it is formed by Egypt and Syria (until 1961). Creation also of the short-term [[Arab Federation|Arab Federation of Iraq and Jordan]].

1959.text: Independence of [[History of Morocco|Morocco]] and [[History of Tunisia|Tunisia]]

1960.text: Independence of French colonies in Africa; the UN reach 99 members states

1961: Assassination of [[Patrice Lumumba]], first prime minister of the [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]], on January 17

Formation of the ''[[Conference of Nationalist Organizations of the Portuguese Colonies|Conferência das Organizações Nacionalistas das Colónias Portuguesas]]'' on April 18 in [[Casablanca]], [[Morocco]] ([[African Party for the Independence of Guinea and Cape Verde|PAIGC]], [[MPLA]], [[FRELIMO]] and [[Movement for the Liberation of São Tomé and Príncipe/Social Democratic Party|MLSTP]])
[[Soviet Union|Soviet premier]] [[Nikita Khrushchev|Khrushchev]] declares that the Soviet Union would support all '[[Wars of national liberation|national liberation movements]]'
Publication of [[Frantz Fanon]]' ''[[The Wretched of the Earth]]''
[[Indian annexation of Goa]] ends [[Portuguese India]] ([[Goa]], [[Dadra and Nagar Haveli|Dadra, Nagar Haveli]], [[Daman and Diu]]).

1961–1974.text: [[Portuguese Colonial War]]; See also [[Angolan War of Independence]] (1961-1989)

1962.text: [[Évian Accords]] halts the [[Algerian War]] and puts end to [[French North Africa|French rule in North-Africa]]

1963.text: Assassination of [[Sylvanus Olympio]] on January 13, first president of [[Togo]]; he is replaced by [[Gnassingbé Eyadéma]], who ruled over Togo until his death in 2005

text: Assassination of [[Mehdi Ben Barka]], leader of the [[National Union of Popular Forces|UNPF]] and of the [[Organization of Solidarity with the People of Asia, Africa and Latin America|Tricontinental Conference]]
[[Mobutu Sese Seko|Joseph Mobutu]] becomes the dictator of the [[Democratic Republic of the Congo|Democratic Republic of Congo]] until his overthrow in 1997 by [[Laurent-Désiré Kabila]]

1969.text: Assassination of [[Eduardo Mondlane]], leader of the [[FRELIMO]]

1970s.text: Independence of the former Portuguese colonies, following the April 25, 1974 [[Carnation Revolution]] and the [[Portuguese Colonial War]]

1971: Independence of [[History of Bangladesh|Bangladesh]] following the [[Bangladesh Liberation War|war with Pakistan]]
Publication of [[Eduardo Galeano]]'s [[Open Veins of Latin America]]
Publication of [[Gustavo Gutiérrez]]'s A [[Liberation theology|Theology of Liberation]]: History, Politics, Salvation

text: Assassination of [[Amílcar Cabral|Amilcar Cabral]], leader of the [[African Party for the Independence of Guinea and Cape Verde]] (PAIGC) on January 20
The PAIGC proclaims the independence of [[Guinea-Bissau]] on September 24
[[History of Portugal|Portugal]] recognizes [[Mozambique]]'s independence on June 25 and [[Angola]] on November 11
[[Green March]] during which Morocco annexes [[Western Sahara]], formerly part of [[Spanish Morocco]].

1979.text: [[Soviet–Afghan War|Soviet invasion of Afghanistan]] and start of the [[Cold War (1979–1985)|'Second Cold War']]

text: The UN reaches 154 member states
Assassination of [[Óscar Romero]], [[prelate]] [[archbishop]] of [[San Salvador]] and proponent of the [[Liberation theology]], on March 24

1982.text: [[Latin American debt crisis]] (in particular in [[Mexico]], [[Brazil]] and [[Argentina]])

1988.text: Assassination of [[Dulcie September]], member of the [[African National Congress]]

1989.text: [[United States invasion of Panama|Operation Just Cause]] against [[Manuel Noriega]]

1990.text: Independence of [[Namibia]], the UN reaches 159 states.

1994.text: [[Nelson Mandela]] becomes president of [[South Africa]] in the nation's first all race election

2001.text: [[Christiane Taubira|French law recognizing slavery and the Atlantic slave trade as crimes against humanity]] (Taubira Law)

2005.text: [[French law on colonialism|February 23 French law]] on the 'positive aspects' of 'French presence abroad, in particular in North Africa'

2006.text: Repeal of the February 23, 2005 French law, following criticisms of [[historical revisionism (negationism)|historical revisionism]]
